text: @samstebbings18 @DiGeremias @_RobbieMoore @AireIncinerator @EnvAgency @IlkleyChat I‚Äôm not, as I‚Äôve previously being critical of the Labour led council. But on this issue, whilst they have abs are of the accountability the planning laws and environmental standards for under the Conservative government‚Äôs remit making them equally accountable.

@bilgribs @Blacky_Himself @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Yes totally, our rivers are in a mess and feels the should be protectors don't actually give a hoot. 
I'm in East anglia and have seen a massive decline over the years. The river waveny and wensum in particular
@smitd28 @DiGeremias @_RobbieMoore @AireIncinerator @EnvAgency @IlkleyChat My point exactly your just defending them every time. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
@jonny34543 Please report this to @EnvAgencyNW

@Nickhod53168394 @Blacky_Himself @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency It is totally bewildering. I have been talking to experts over the last few days ... and they say mass fish kills are usually associated with significant pollution events. If the EA does not attend then it is very unlikely that the polluters will be prosecuted or held to account.
@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm What you should be doing is removing the dead swans off the river other birds are eating them
@bilgribs @Blacky_Himself @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Shocking that
@MerseyRivers @CroxtethHall @EnvAgencyNW @ccnw1 @cpvolgroup @lpoolcouncil And if you encircled it with EGRP you could increase its capacity and require fewer ponds downstream
@IanJonesEA @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @CIWEM @floodandcoast Cheers @IanJonesEA !!!
@paulcotswolds @gloss @EnvAgency I understand this is an issue in Northleach too, I've been advised not to go in the river beyond the sewage works.
